definition.text: The Smoothed Moving Average (SMMA) is similar to the Simple Moving Average (SMA) in that it aims to reduce noise rather than reduce lag.

paragraphs.text: The SMMA is a combination of the EMA and SMA and uses all prices in it's lookback period, but assigns lower weight on older prices.
When compared to the EMA and the SMA, the SMMA will produce a value between the other two moving averages.
This indicator produces two SMMA values; a fast and a slow period value.
The following properties are available to access:

| Product Name | Product Variable | Properties |
| SMMA | smma | value1, value2 |
The length of the indicator's moving average can be changed by locating and opening the Javascript Code under Data Building Procedure -> Procedure Loop under "SMMA" Procedure Loop.
